intro: Celsia barnadesii var. mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritanian celsia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Celastraceae family and is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to harsh desert environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human encroachment. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
